functional.func_cartesian module

functional.func_cartesian.get_closest_neighbors_el_cartesian_coor(dataframe, max_neighbors_radius, el, var_filename)

This function calculates the closest neighbors of a specific element in Cartesian coordinates within a specified radius. It updates the DataFrame with distances to neighbors and their coordinates.

Parameters:

  • dataframe (DataFrame) – The pandas DataFrame containing Cartesian coordinates.

  • max_neighbors_radius (float) – The maximum distance within which neighbors are considered.

  • el (str) – The element for which closest neighbors are to be found.

  • var_filename (str) – A variable used for naming dictionary columns in the DataFrame.

Note

  • Don’t know if this of any use

functional.func_cartesian.get_fractional_to_cartesian_coor(dataframe, destination_directory, var_filename)

This function calculates the Cartesian coordinates for atoms in each structure file listed in the DataFrame. It utilizes lattice information and fractional coordinates to derive the Cartesian coordinates. It updates the DataFrame with dictionary of cartesian coordinates with elements as the key of dictionary.

Parameters:

  • dataframe (DataFrame) – The pandas DataFrame containing lattice constant and geometry information.

  • destination_directory (str) – The directory where the structure files are located.

  • var_filename (str) – The structure files (can be either in POSCAR or CIF format). The variable used also for naming dictionary columns in the DataFrame.

functional.func_cartesian.get_fractional_to_cartesian_matrix(dataframe, var_filename, angle_in_degrees=True)

This function calculates the fractional to cartesian matrix for each entry in the DataFrame based on lattice constants and angles provided. It updates the DataFrame with the calculated matrices.

Source: https://gist.github.com/Bismarrck/a68da01f19b39320f78a

Parameters:

  • dataframe (DataFrame) – The pandas DataFrame containing lattice constant information.

  • var_filename (str) – A variable used for naming dictionary columns in the DataFrame.

  • angle_in_degrees (bool, optional) – Whether the angles are given in degrees (default is True).
